Caption: Fig. 1. Visualization of radiation (CPM values) along the Tokio-Fukushima highway.

Fig. 2. Alternatives for color-coding attribute values along trajectory pect S → A and another one on the temporal aspect T → A. Moreover, bands. Top: plain color-coding requires less space; middle: two-tone each view must be equipped with facilities to establish a connection to pseudo-coloring [30] increases precision; bottom: color filtering reduces the dimension it is not focusing on.
Fig. 3. Mapping trajectory points to form a colored path.
Fig. 4. Visualization of trajectories as colored 3D bands and 2D paths.
Fig. 5. The time lens visualizes temporally aggregated information.

Fig. 6. The time graph shows the dynamics of attribute values within trajectories by two-tone pseudo-coloring. The alignment of the trajectories has a significant impact on what can be seen in the display (left: alignment by time of the day, right: alignment by start time).
Fig. 7. The development of a traffic jam in San Francisco.
Fig. 8. Traffic in the Brest harbor (left) and in its south-west part (right).
Fig. 9. Comparison of the tortuosity of incoming (left) and outgoing (right) vessels at the Ile Longue peninsula in the Brest harbor.
